## Title (required)

Fixes #212 - Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)

## Description (required)

Fixes #212 - Remove from EXIF: copyright field (name)

Implemented the modification of EXIF tags in class FileProcessor. The EXIF tags "Artist" and "Copyright" are modified to remove a specific string. This string is specified by the user in preferences. The function returns the URI of the new file. ShareActivity calls this function and passes the returned URI to the uploader. I also changed the behaviour of getPathOfMediaOrCopy. If redaction is enabled, getPathOfMediaOrCopy always makes a copy of the file. The path to this copy is stored in variable fileOrCopyPath and the function always returns this path.

## Tests performed (required)

Tested on API level 22, Genymotion Google Nexus 5 - 5.1.0 emulator, with build variant betaDebug

## Description (required)
The app name has been 'Commons' (and not 'Wikimedia Commons') for a
very long time. For completely unknown reasons, the Tamil (ta)
translation of the app name stuck with the translation for 'Wikimedia
Commons' regardless of the fact that the translation had been
corrected at translatewiki.net in the year 2016. The correction
somehow didn't reflect here during the localisation updates from
tranlsatewiki.net.

Ignoring the weirdness, correct the translation of the app name
to reflect it's current name.

Commons' regardless of the fact that the translation had been
corrected at translatewiki.net in the year 2016. The correction
somehow didn't reflect here during the localisation updates from
tranlsatewiki.net.

Ignoring the weirdness, correct the translation of the app name
to reflect it's current name.

## Add direction the user is facing to Nearby real-time position

Fixes #1452
Fixes #1659

## Description (required)

Fixes #1452
Getting azimuth:
Data from sensors and screen rotation are collected in NearbyActivity and sent to CompassUtils (new class), static method computes azimuth taking into account rotation of device and swaping coordinate system if needed. After azimuth is computed it is send into NearbyMapFragment. 

Icon rotation:
I could not use Marker class which was used until now for current location marker. I had two options when implementing this. First was to change Marker to MarkerView and second use SymbolLayer which meant adding new layer to map and isolate icon on this layer where it can be rotated.

I discarded first option as MarkerView was depracted.

Using SymbolLayer meant slight changes to current location marker logic as layer does not have marker but only has icons and source set which contains positions of icons. 
These changes were changing current location marker from Marker to Feature, updating animator and evaluator for current location marker.
Fixes #1659
updating mapbox version to latest solved the issue
MapBoxTelemtery class was changed in latest versions. In code we had telemetry disabled. I used Telementry.disableOnUserRequest() to disable it. Reason for change was that old method is no longer static and this should do same thing. 

## Tests performed (required)

api 23, Samsung Galaxy J5 with betaDebug, prodDebug
api 26, emulator with betaDebug, prodDebug
api 23, emulator with betaDebug

In emulator map was broken with black squares appearing on map. It only appears in emulator, on smartphone map works as should without black squares. This error appeared between two test sessions and I believe it is not caused by my code as I tested master branch and map also had black squares. I did testing on mapbox 6.2.0 as master currently does not work due to #1659.

![screenshot_1529666482](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9913181/41848100-9dfc0f18-787c-11e8-8251-1b583d6428c4.png)

body:
Temporary fix for #1599 . We are concerned that people who enabled the "automatically get current location" setting prior to the subtext change may not realize that their location is being added to the image's location template. This removes current location retrieval entirely from the upload process, and removes the Setting as well.

Where possible, I have left methods intact so that in the future if we decide to reimplement this (retrieving current location solely for category suggestions but not adding it to the template), we will not need to rewrite code. However, I have removed most of the method calls, and methods that would affect the user (e.g. the snackbar requesting location permissions).

As an added bonus, this should fix #1515 since the LocationListener will not be registered in ShareActivity.

Tested on Nexus S emulator running API 25 on betaDebug. To test:
- Make sure GPS is on and your image has no geotagged coordinates
- Upload that image
- Check your uploaded image and make sure no location template was added to it

## Explore activity & picture of the day added Fixes #1553 ## Description - Explore activity added for browse feature - Added tab layout and viewpager for exploring featured images, picture of the day. - Added ViewPager Adapter which will contain fragments. - 2 instance of Category Image Fragment added in viewpager fragments (POTD, Featured) - Featured option is now replaced by Explore option in Navigation drawer Also for search feature - Search, Explore Icon added in drawables. - Search Option is shown in toolbar of Explore activity. I will add working on search feature in another PR. Fixes #1553 {Describe the changes made and why they were made.} ## Tests performed (required) Manually tested on [API 25 Motog5S+] with ProdDebug Please test on ProdDebug as betadebug variant doesn't have featured Images, POTD ## Screenshots showing what changed
![screenshot_20180525-152200](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19607555/40573438-46b3a2d4-60df-11e8-9ffb-d7fd6c0b2a80.png) ![screenshot_20180526-120910](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19607555/40573437-467b339a-60df-11e8-81d8-d063c6a2c76d.png) ![screenshot_20180526-120914](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19607555/40573451-840ca6f8-60df-11e8-81ad-8b4bf4e145ba.png)

Fixes #1091 . Tested by uploading via app and "share" on prodDebug build, real device running Android 7.0.

Changes made:
- ~~Directed all upload entry points to ShareActivity. MultipleShareActivity.java will be removed completely in a future PR~~ This redirection cannot be done yet if we are to release 2.8 with this PR.
- Added Javadocs to methods of ShareActivity
- Reduced number of lines in ShareActivity from 1000+ to 600+ by extracting file processing functions to FileProcessor.java (if they made sense to be associated with an object) or to FileUtils.java (if they made sense to be static), and extracting zoom functions to Zoom.java.
- Unified the FileUtils in Upload package and the FileUtils in Utils package, as there is no point in having 2 different FileUtils and it was causing a lot of confusion
- Simplified permission logic in ShareActivity, there is no point having storage permissions requested in the snackbar as well as at the Submit button, as it is mandatory. The snackbar is now used solely for the optional Location permission
- Removed as much unnecessary code as possible from onCreate(), reducing number of lines by more than half

body:
time-based randomness is biased - if someone uploaded 100 images in
hour, one week ago, and I select a random point in time, their last
image is way more likely to come up than anything else.

With this, there is still bias towards choosing one of the last N
in any burst of uploads (where N is the number of recent changes
fetched) but it's a bit better than before.

commit_messages:
More random recent image selection (#1542)

time-based randomness is biased - if someone uploaded 100 images in
hour, one week ago, and I select a random point in time, their last
image is way more likely to come up than anything else.

With this, there is still bias towards choosing one of the last N
in any burst of uploads (where N is the number of recent changes
fetched) but it's a bit better than before.

This PR enables crosswiki notifications so that some of the wikidata and wikipedia notifications(currently thank you edits) can be seen in the app. 

Moreover, it does quite a few UI fixes:
- removes whitespace from the beginning of a notification
- shows appropriate notification icon, fetching it from the server
- parses HTML string to show unescaped string

Notifications page now looks much better :)

![notifications](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3069373/40273403-5edf7f38-5bdd-11e8-8b10-ead226889b61.png)

body:
## Description

This PR move us most of the way toward a rewrite of the API layer of the app with a couple of goals
* Move off the deprecated Apache based libraries and consolidate onto a single networking library (OkHttp)
* Move off the deprecated XML based mediawiki api and to using the JSON based mediawiki api

The work is *not complete* but I wanted this in the team's hands sooner rather than later!  Aiming to merge to a centralized feature branch to continue the work.

## Tests performed

At this point it's possible to log into the app (beta and prod variants) and view your contributions.  I only have a single "useful" notification so testing loading those was a little sketchy, so it would be great if someone else could take a look.  There are a couple of gaps in the API still needing to be filled in; manual testing will fail if you bump into a `// TODO` comment on an unimplemented method.

## Still to do

Look at the `// TODO` comments in the code - there are a couple of spots still to fill in.  I've not tackled upload yet, but got some of the infrastructure in place for someone to be able to fill that in.  It's going to need a little creativity to pull *progress notifications* from the OkHttp upload.

~The modeling of responses is another area for refactoring to better adhere to the Open/Closed principle; infrastructure is in place to be able to return something other than my initial `ApiResponse` class, just now need to break it up a little.~  ‚úÖ **Done**

Also missing is Javadoc.  Yeah, about that.  üòâ

body:
## Description

The PR was inspired by trying to get some good unit tests around the loading of GPS categories.  There was an awful lot going on in the API class, particularly 
* An embedded (static) class acting as a shared model (tough for testing)
* Inner classes modeling the JSON returned by the Mediawiki Json API 
* The `toString()` method was the trigger to do data extraction - categories were being processed as a result of a **Log statement**.

**Changes made:**

* The `CategoryApi` and associated `GpsCategoryModel` classes now adhere to the [single responsibility principle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_responsibility_principle)
* The categories loaded as a result of the GPS query are now held in a shared model -`GpsCategoryModel` - injectable where needed using Dagger.
* In the process of cleaning things up I consolidated us from 3 HTTP libraries (Volley, OkHttp and the deprecated Apache HTTP library) down to 2 (OkHttp and the deprecated Apache library).
* The modeling of some small part of the Mediawiki Json API has been extracted - we can build on that as we move the app over to more of the Json API.
* Tests were created around the newly extracted classes

## Tests performed

The app was tested using the _prod_ variant, as there's better data available.  Categories loaded asynchronously as expected.  Unit tests were added to the suite.

body:
As mentioned at #891 , WMF has pretty strict rules about how we maintain user privacy if we are to remain on their Play Store account. When the user taps "send log file" in Settings, they should be sending the file to the private forum (only accessed by devs who have signed the NDA), not the public one.

This is the 3rd time I have needed to make this change, as it keeps being overridden :( (see #974 and #1000). I have modified the variable names and removed header sharing with the feedback option to be even more explicit. Please please be aware of this.

One of the items needed in #1329 . I was wondering why the check for text wrap doesn't work for me, and it turns out that getLineCount() was returning 0. According to documentation, it seems that happens when the internal layout has not been built.

This seems like a simple workaround. Additionally, there is no need to check all the line lengths when "Directions" is the longest, so checking for that should simplify things.

Tested on Android 7.0 Samsung Galaxy s7

Would ideally be merged prior to release #1212

body:
## Description

Fixes #171 (partly)

Some activities that have the hideKeyboard function or same functionality have lint warnings about null pointer exception. Additionally, LeakCanary says that leaks appear in the same code. 
For example in fr.free.nrw.commons.debug:2.6.7-debug-master~fe1f0b52:82.
* fr.free.nrw.commons.auth.LoginActivity has leaked:
* GC ROOT static android.view.inputmethod.InputMethodManager.sInstance
* references android.view.inputmethod.InputMethodManager.mLastSrvView
* references android.support.design.widget.TextInputEditText.mContext
* leaks fr.free.nrw.commons.auth.LoginActivity instance

body:
The PR intends to merge the gigantic `directNearbyUploadsNew` branch to master. The branch is getting bigger and bigger and it might get difficult to maintain it given `master` is so active these days. The branch has a lot of new features and everything is not expected to work smoothly but we can pick up the issues one by one after the merge is completed. 

The next release is planned in the next 2 weeks. We should be able to fix any major issues before then.

body:
This PR adds category suggestions to direct Nearby uploads. The category associated with the Wikidata item that the user is uploading from should be added to the top of the category suggestions screen. Not all Wikidata items have categories, however. To check if an item has a category when you test it, you can play around with the query [here](https://query.wikidata.org/#SELECT%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3Flocation%29%20as%20%3Flocation%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3Fitem%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Fitem_label_preferred_language%2C%20%3Fitem_label_any_language%29%29%20as%20%3Flabel%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3FclassId%29%20as%20%3Fclass%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Fclass_label_preferred_language%2C%20%3Fclass_label_any_language%2C%20%22%3F%22%29%29%20as%20%3Fclass_label%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Ficon0%2C%20%3Ficon1%29%29%20as%20%3Ficon%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28COALESCE%28%3Femoji0%2C%20%3Femoji1%29%29%20as%20%3Femoji%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%28SAMPLE%28%3FCommons_category%29%20as%20%3FCommons_category%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3FwikipediaArticle%0A%20%20%20%20%20%3FcommonsArticle%0A%0A%20%20%20WHERE%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Around%20given%20location...%0A%20%20%20%20%20SERVICE%20wikibase%3Aaround%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP625%20%3Flocation.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20bd%3AserviceParam%20wikibase%3Acenter%20%22Point%28153.073%20-27.6111%29%22%5E%5Egeo%3AwktLiteral.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20bd%3AserviceParam%20wikibase%3Aradius%20%225%22%20.%20%23%20Radius%20in%20kilometers.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20...%20and%20without%20an%20image.%0A%20%20%20%20%20MINUS%20%7B%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP18%20%5B%5D%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20the%20label%20in%20the%20preferred%20language%20of%20the%20user%2C%20or%20any%20other%20language%20if%20no%20label%20is%20available%20in%20that%20language.%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%3Fitem%20rdfs%3Alabel%20%3Fitem_label_preferred_language.%20FILTER%20%28lang%28%3Fitem_label_preferred_language%29%20%3D%20%22en%22%29%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%3Fitem%20rdfs%3Alabel%20%3Fitem_label_any_language%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20Commons%20category%20%28P373%29%0A%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONAL%20%7B%20%3Fitem%20wdt%3AP373%20%3FCommons_category.%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%23%20Get%20the%20c Description
The nearby activity refresh layout (swipe up on the nearby activity) doesn't been hided when the refresh is aborted (for example, when the location doesn't change) 
Now, if the refresh doesn't take place than the circle will be hided and the refresh will stop.

In case other apps want to send a title and description along with the
image, we check if those have been passed as intent extras and set the
EditText values accordingly.

Fixes: #1273
See also: #892

Launch Rate Us Feature from AboutActivity (#1264)

* Launch Rate Us Feature from AboutActivity

Rate us feature is added in Utils, But it is never used/launched.

* Add LaunchRatings Method in AboutActivity

* Fix Package Name to enable rate us feature

The rate us feature was not working for the debug build type since getPackageName() was returning the fr.free.nrw.commons.debug. Use of this package name was leading to an error on google play.

* Replace getPackageName() with BuildConfig.class.getPackage().getName() in rateApp method of Utils.java

### Description
Clicking the download button now downloads each image uploaded in future without any kind of failure. The PR fixes #1216. 
Changes were made to SingleUploadFragment.java where the title of the image was modified in a way so as to handle the incoming of spaces in the formed URL. The spaces was replaced by a '_' 
This works for all the newly uploaded images in the future and not for previously existing images, since their URL has already been formed while uploading them to the database.

### Testing
The changes have been tested on a real-time device and a few corner cases for image titles have been tried out as well.

body:
## Description
Makes real time position track posible

Fixes #686 

Another type of callback is added to LocationCahngedManager so that we are notified for slight location changes and significant ones. 
- Tracks user on walking or driving.
- Uploads new nearby markers whenever user went out of current area composed from current nearby markers.
- Makes current position marker visible whenever bottom list sheet is visible or not. 
- Updates items in the list view when new nearby markers comes, means on significant update.

Note: You can use Lockito app to simulate a moving route.
Also Note: Please do not merge this yet since it has some known bugs:
- Doesn't clean old markers in some cases.
- Of course conflicts...

## Screencast showing what changed
 
![realtimelocation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3127881/36925396-d089ccac-1e83-11e8-8f67-01f941fa1e1d.gif)

body:
For #1130  (j), the exception occurs when app tries to open a dialog from ExistingFileAsync (extends AsyncTaskin) in this case. To fix, we can check if parent activity (the share activity in this case) is still running and show dialog only when it's finished.
To get parent activity into the  ExistingFileAsync class, we can pass it as a parameter. But, this will cause memory leaks when task is complete. 
![weak](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25305892/36652870-875fb1ac-1a7f-11e8-9e6a-0f8a0ba0be9c.png)
Solution is to use WeakReference to let the Garbage collector know. I also changed context to be a weakReference. 
Best

I have noticed that '--stacktrace' option creates clutters that are often useless, which in part may be responsible for making people to ignore Travis errors.

It will show us stacktraces for gradle code (such as build.gradle) - since we rarely change gradle code, methods lists like the one below are typically meaningless:

```
org.gradle.api.ProjectConfigurationException: A problem occurred configuring project ':app'.
	at org.gradle.configuration.project.LifecycleProjectEvaluator.addConfigurationFailure(LifecycleProjectEvaluator.java:87)
	at org.gradle.configuration.project.LifecycleProjectEvaluator.notifyAfterEvaluate(LifecycleProjectEvaluator.java:82)
	at org.gradle.configuration.project.LifecycleProjectEvaluator.doConfigure(LifecycleProjectEvaluator.java:69)
	at org.gradle.configuration.project.LifecycleProjectEvaluator.access$100(LifecycleProjectEvaluator.java:33)
	at org.gradle.configuration.project.LifecycleProjectEvaluator$ConfigureProject.run(LifecycleProjectEvaluator.java:103)
...
```

I guess this is an option best to be used locally only when needed.

(I think this will cause an error affected by #1068.)

body:
I decided to submit this PR after getting the Nearby Map direct uploads for #252 sorted, and will work on the Nearby List direct uploads in a separate PR. This is aimed at allowing @neslihanturan to start work on updating the user's real-time position in the Nearby Map once this PR has been merged, while minimizing conflicts. I have tested this on an emulator running API 25.

What this PR does:
- Hooks up the camera and gallery buttons in Nearby Map to their respective uploads
- Checks and prompts for permissions as needed
- Saves the title and desc of the Nearby item selected, and autofills the title and desc text fields in ShareActivity respectively
- Applies the #1034 fixes to this branch (as the Nearby code has changed drastically in this branch)

What this PR does NOT cover (and will thus need to be handled in our future PRs):
- Hooking up camera/gallery buttons in Nearby List
- Category suggestions based on Nearby item categories
- Editing Wikidata P18 property
- Fixing memory leaks

This PR addresses the need to have consistent sizing of margins, padding and other layout elements within the app, as requested in issue #886 

For the most part, the app was already fairly consistent just with hard-coded sizes in its layout files directly. A few of the layouts in welcome, login, the drawer and about were adjusted.  In a few cases I left the hard-coded size in the layout file when it was pertinent to that file only.

Font size change for the "heading" and margins/padding changed slightly to standardize.  In a couple of spots there was a layout container or margins that provided no value so was cleaned up.

body: Building upon the infra that @psh provided, am replacing the usage of async task for login with RxJava. Doing this refactoring as I wanted to write login UI tests. This PR serves as the base for that.

- Fixes the issue where nearby list was not loaded in the first attempt. 

How to reproduce?
- Initially phone's GPS is off or the Commons app doesn't have location permissions.
- Either of these things are provided at run time.
- The nearby list just keeps loading. 
- It loads after killing the app. 

The above issue is now fixed. 

- App was continuously listening for location updates and draining a lot of battery

How do you know?
- The location Setting page in the your phone tags Commons app as high battery usage application. 

The above should be hopefully fixed. 
- The app now stops listening for location updates as soon as the nearby list is populated. 
- It again registers the location manager when the refresh button is clicked. 

- App now uses multiple providers to fetch the location. 

Why?

`GPS_PROVIDER` is usually slower. Now the app would be using both `NETWORK_PROVIDER` for coarse location and `GPS_PROVIDER` for finer location. Upon receiving a location update, it will determine if the newer location is better than the last location. If it is, the newer location would be used. 

Also fixes #982.

This PR has been waiting in the wings for a while and completes the work for #890, to inject dependencies everywhere in the app using Dagger.  I feel like this story closes #890.

The driving change here is that code should not be reaching back to the main `CommonsApplication` for dependencies - they should all come from Dagger.  Along the way that meant introducing a few classes to clean up operations that the application class was doing that it shouldn't (for instance, session management) and refactoring to allow for *constructor injection* of dependencies for some existing classes that were reaching out to the main application.

body:
As discussed in #74, this attempts to detect 2 kinds of unwanted pictures:
1-Images that are too dark
2-Images that are blurry. 

When the app detects an image which it finds to be too dark or blurry it shows a popup with an error message. The popup is basically a warning since the user can choose to ignore it and continue uploading the image. 

As for the image processing part,  detecting images that are too dark works quite flawlessly as per my testing. I have never come across an image that was pointed out as being too dark incorrectly or vice versa. 

On the other hand, while blurry images detection works well enough, the results become less consistent for images taken during the night and/or in poor lighting. It isn't that it fails every time, just that every now and then you will run into an image which looks sharp but was marked as blurry by the app. I have tweaked and played with the configuration quite a lot with the current setup working best for me. However I am not completely convinced. 

That said, having worked on it for quite a while, I felt best to put the code out for others to see. Maybe having some fresh eyes could lead to changes/improvements.   

P.S: I have added the OpenCV library to the repository as part of this pull request. However I found [this](https://github.com/jlhonora/opencv-android-sample/blob/master/.gitignore) gitignore file that suggests excluding the library from the repository. This will need to be discussed. 

Also we will definitely need to add a section in the Wiki about setting up OpenCV.

Merge pull request #882 from Bluesir9/issue_#881_signup_beta_redirection_correction

Moved sign up process redirection urls to build.gradle
Closes #881

Add CONTRIBUTING file (#879)

* docs: add an initial version of commit message/contributors guideline

The project has long evolved without a guideline for commit messages
and a contributors guideline. This has led to a lot mysteries in the
code base.

To avoid such mysteries in the code base in the future, add an intial
version of the commit message guideline in the form of a contributors
guideline.

The name 'CONTRIBUTING' is pretty common and also ensures that GitHub
(the place where this project currnetly evolves) brings the document to
notice to an user trying to create Pull Request. Further, the all caps
ensure it catches the eyes of the gazing user.

This initial version of guideline is based on the git project's guideline
for submitting patches (Documentation/SubmittingPatches).

* contributing: remove internal link

Markdown doesn't seem to be supporting internal links(fragments) to other
parts of the document.

So, replace it with normal text to refer to the section.

* contributing: fix typo and improve sentence

* contributing: add link to related wiki page

* contributing: fix typo

* contributing: quote section name correectly

Only part of the name of a section was quoted thus referring to
an inexistent section and making the sentence meaningless.

So, quote it completely.

* contributing: use plural to refer to wiki pages

A change might obsolete "multiple" Wiki pages, which have
technical documentation about the app.

So, use plural to refer to the wiki pages.

* contributing: move the main contributing file to the wiki

The document was based on Git project's guidelines for submitting
patches (Documentation/SubmittingPatches). As it was licensed under
GPLv2 while this porject is licensed under an Apache license a license
conflict arose.

To solve it move the main document which might be susceptible to
license issues to the wiki while keeping a jist of it in the
document itself.

* contributing: use lenient wording for steps that might be optional

It's not possible to write tests for all changes. For example, UI
changes. Also, it's not the case that the Wiki pages become stale all
the time.

So, use lineant wordings for optional steps

* contributing: correct grammar in a sentence

"documented in" reads better than "documented at" (at least for
me).

If this is wrong then we can revert it.

* contributing: add link to guidelines in the wiki page

* contributing: replace 'jist' with 'gist'

  "Jist is a pronunciation spelling of the word just when spoken
   with an American Southern accent.

   Gist is a noun that means a quick summary or the main point of
   something."

I intended to use the latter. So, ..

just gave the icons a simple white border to make them pop and more visible on the home screen.

![logo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18133700/30209837-c869615a-944e-11e7-9c87-4f252ff5b5e2.PNG)

(Partially) fixed issue #844 by:

1. incrementing time of debounce for search filter from 0.3s to 0.5s. The smaller time was causing sending multiple requests before user ended typing and when they showed up, they were already out-of-date. Incrementing time by 0.2s is not visible to the user, so it doesn‚Äôt impact UX.
2. adding sorting results by string similarity - I used [java-string-similarity](https://github.com/tdebatty/java-string-similarity) library with a Levenshtein algorithm to implement this. There are some tests write for sorting, so you can check how it works.

However, because of a limited number of results from API, this fix is not 100% correct - there can be better results for user inputs that are on the next pages of this request, so this solution only improves search for what we already get from API.

This PR aims to address #665.  

I looked at how some other apps with nav drawers (Gmail, Google Music, Google Play) handle the case where the user taps Activity Z from the drawer while already in Activity Z.  They appear to just close the drawer instead of starting an additional instance of the activity.  

I've implemented this here.  This should prevent the user from tapping the back button and having it seem not to work because the back stack has the same activity multiple times in succession.

body:
I think we had a consensus on using RxJava2.
Here, I replace Guava with RxJava2 for the `getUploadCount` method.

Advantages:

- Works perfectly fine.
- Handles threading and activity lifecycle (looks like the guava one didn't handle activity lifecycle?).
- It is much more readable.
- We have to maintain much less code.
- The apk is 200KB smaller.
- The apk contains 4150 fewer methods.

This also opens the door to preventing double-clicks, timeouts, etc in a very very easy one (one line of code).
I hope you guys like it :)

Hi, this is my first contribution to an open source app.  Please let me know if I'm doing anything incorrectly!

This is meant to address https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/issues/397.  In the English `strings.xml` I replaced "Wikimedia Commons" with a placeholder and added a separate string holding the trademarked name.  I added a method to `HtmlTextView.java` so the html string could be updated programmatically (without being set to the raw text).  In `AboutActivity.java` I added code to set the the license text. 


I'm very unclear on how the translation process works.  For example, is marking the trademarked string with `translatable="false` (i.e. `<string name="trademarked_name" translatable="false">Wikimedia Commons</string>`) sufficient?  How do I document the fact that the `about_license` string has changed and needs translation?  

I appreciate any feedback.

body:
The error 
```
fr.free.nrw.commons.mwapi.ApacheHttpClientMediaWikiApiTest > initializationError FAILED
    java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
        Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
```
Most likely stems from the deprecated code.  I believe that `SchemeRegistry` has been been removed in the newest API levels and the gradle flag `useLibrary 'org.apache.http.legacy'` gets around the problem for production code, but Robolectric is being strict in its emulation of the API level in the tests.  Although `ApacheHttpClientMediaWikiApiTest` was annotated to pin it to API 21, `NearbyAdapterFactoryTest` was not so I think the highest API level (recently changed to 25 in `gradle.properties`) was winning.  I ran the tests on the command line with gradle and inside Android Studio and they were green with this tweak.  Hopefully it fixes #783 (Travis build error)!

body:
I was initially just going to fix i18n-related issues in MediaDetailFragment, but it had some important bugs that I felt had to be fixed. I hope these are not too many changes for a single PR, as they are all focused on the same screen:

### Crash when no upload date is set

The code assumed that the upload date for `Media` was not nullable. This can happen when the upload fails, for instance.
I added the appropriate annotation and prevented the crash.

Crash-log:

```java
07-15 18:24:00.399 29217-29217/fr.free.nrw.commons E/AndroidRuntime: 
FATAL EXCEPTION: main
Process: fr.free.nrw.commons, PID: 29217
java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.lang.String java.util.Date.toString()' on a null object reference
 at fr.free.nrw.commons.media.MediaDetailFragment.prettyUploadedDate(MediaDetailFragment.java:330)
 at fr.free.nrw.commons.media.MediaDetailFragment.access$1500(MediaDetailFragment.java:31)
 at fr.free.nrw.commons.media.MediaDetailFragment$4.onPostExecute(MediaDetailFragment.java:219)
 at fr.free.nrw.commons.media.MediaDetailFragment$4.onPostExecute(MediaDetailFragment.java:186)
 at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:660)
 at android.os.AsyncTask.-wrap1(AsyncTask.java)
 at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:677)
 at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
 at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154)
 at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6077)
 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:866)
 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:756)
```

### Some strings were hardcoded

A couple of strings were hardcoded in the layout xml. I extracted them to `strings.xml`. I followed a naming convention similar to other strings in that area, and avoided adding invisible strings to the translatable set (for instance: `License link`).

### Wrong RTL support

The layout tried to offer RTL support using `left|start`, which is wrong. Fixed it to use `start`.

### Categories would behave wrongly: adding object blindly

| Before  | After |
| ------- | ----- |
| ![mediadetail categories repeat](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10153800/28241079-c7b0e6fc-698d-11e7-8ce3-99fe7bec560a.gif) | ![mediadetail categories correct](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10153800/28241114-59ab88b4-698e-11e7-9b7b-fdc02e11e136.gif)  |

body:
Fix for #667 

This bug can be reproduced on low/bad connections only. Because of asynchronus work of getting new categories

Problem was in async requests, and reaction on cancel was wrong.
First of all to decrease impact on phone internet connection - request should start on after text changed, and cancel on before text changed to deliver proper results.

Also requesting on create view was unnecessary, because results may deliver BEFORE view attached to fragment

Changes on this PR

* Converted the "nearby" list to use a `RecyclerView` utilizing the excellent ["Renderers" library](https://github.com/pedrovgs/Renderers) (Apache 2.0 license).
* Unit tested the new list implementation using [Robolectric](http://robolectric.org/),
* Ran static code analysis on the "nearby" package and cleaned up the small issues noted.
* Deleted dead code.

This PR covers one step for Issue #743 (replace listviews)

body:
In the process of refactoring related to the networking stack, I introduced a class `ApacheHttpClientMediaWikiApi` and felt the need to at least _smoke test_ a few API calls to make sure that requests and responses are correctly handled.  I used the `MockWebServer` (from OkHttp) to serve up canned responses and assert that requests are well formed at a unit-test level.  This was already a transitive dependency from the mapbox library, made explicit in the `build.gradle` file.

My refactor pulls all of the API calls into a single place so that the body of the app depends on a `MediaWikiApi` interface returning application specific models, with a concrete `ApacheHttpClientMediaWikiApi` class that hides the implementation.  This makes the code more _testable_ (isolating the networking tests to a single class) and makes it easier to use mocks in the rest of the app if you want to unit test just the interactions later.

Although the testing isn't yet complete, I wanted to get the code into your hands as (IMO) it forms a solid basis to address your high-priority item #705 (upload tests).  This PR doesn't include those tests, but it does aim to _set you up for success_ in this endeavor.  :)

body:
When you try to add category and type very fast (or delete very fast), it was hanging. As far as I understand, the reason was, AsyncTask doInBackgrounds can‚Äôt finish when you are too fast and somehow you have several running doInBackground methods, even if you cancel the tasks. Sometimes, they run in an order without problem, but when a magical thing happens which I am not sure about, the first task never ends and the others hang consequently. 
After uploading 22 test images, changing only 2 line is a little sad though:)

Attempted fix for #457.

EDIT: since this PR became rather long, here is a quick summary.
* What this is about: it changes the way files shared between the camera and the app, and the timings of when storage permission is requested.
* What needs to be done: testing photo-capturing and sharing from the gallery on (ideally, physical) devices with across different versions of Android, and code review of the rather large changes of [ShareActivity.java](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/pull/727/files#diff-a83ce591f5495a6097b96f65d03c9a4c) and other files.

API 22 (emulator), API 23 (real device) and API 25 (emulator) have been covered my (manual) tests - taking and sharing a photo, sharing from gallery and EXIF extraction.

Anyone willing to do it for API 24 and API 26 preferably on physical devices?

body:
Note: It is not ready yes please do not approve it.

On pre-hackathon UI designers prepared 3 design suggestion for our app and we decided to use the one in the middle. 
![somethiny](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3127881/26728824/37af9422-47b4-11e7-891b-cce835642899.jpg)

Yours tab is the tab for our contributions, and others tab is to explore nearby photos. I implemented it as following screen shots and still working on it. 

![device-2017-06-02-165749](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3127881/26729031/e66b087a-47b4-11e7-9d01-a17f730517c3.png)
![device-2017-06-02-165826](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3127881/26729032/e6724086-47b4-11e7-9f1d-55bcc15a8a89.png)

Don't get too excited, notification isn't working. I hardcoded it:). 

Known problems:

- Fragment becomes empty on resume
- Explore tab is not written yet
- Notification for closest nearby place (or something else) is not working.
- Crashes on rotation change:)
- And I think some memory problem

If one of you knows a quick solution for these problems please go for it.

On the other hand, I need your ideas about:

1. Because we carried upload buttons from action bar to a cell in gridview, if user go down, then she needs to come back all the way up to upload something.

- The solution of mine is adding a floating button to the right bottom corner to go top. 

2. It looks nice in this orientation, but what if user decides to use phone horizontal? Then there needs to be 4 cells per row (because 2 is too big for vertical), consequently the short side of the notification rectangle will be next to the one of square images. It would look like : 
![device-2017-06-02-170912](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3127881/26729529/8e697fb0-47b6-11e7-9f55-eccdb7815ca1.png)
Some possible solutions that I can imagine:

- Use 2 rows for both vertical and horizontal
- Use squares instead of rectangles when orientation is horizontal (my vote goes to this)

3. If there is no notification, and we decide to use rectagle shaped upload button area, then we have the same problem. Possible solutions:

- Never remove notification area, even if there is no notification, we can put "You dont have any notifications" (this option would be mush easier)
- When there is no notification, remove notification area and make upload area square as other grid cells. 

ƒ∞deas?

body: Considering we know that the variable `firstLine` is only true on the first pass of the while loop, we are able to take it out of the while loop. As the while loop is very expensive, iterating over hundreds of thousand of times, it seems redundant to do such a comparison (i.e. `if (firstLine)`) that many times when the outcome is deterministic and easy to write.

body:
Fixes #435. There could be several approaches for fixing the crash but in our case simply allowing `commitAllowingStateLoss` should be good enough. Feel free to take a look at these links [1](https://medium.com/inloop/demystifying-androids-commitallowingstateloss-cb9011a544cc)[2](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14860239/checking-if-state-is-saved-before-committing-a-fragmenttransaction) for this fix. 

Also the [article](http://www.androiddesignpatterns.com/2013/08/fragment-transaction-commit-state-loss.html) explaining various use cases is also a good read. 

If the user puts the app in background after selecting a picture(either from gallery or clicking from camera) then ideally we should not commit the `SingleUploadFragment` fragment transaction. Its acceptable for us to allow for state loss rather than crashing the app.

body:
I found this kind of funny how long a truly useless piece of code could last for.

This method was added in 4df8ec8fa940c0ff7f7a999379bb29b17064f4a3 but was never used in that commit nor can I find a single usage of the method in the 3.5 years it's been there.

Also I tested it and it doesn't seem to of ever worked correctly anyway. The output of doing `implode(",", Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c"))` is `"[a, b, c],[a, b, c],[a, b, c]"` when it should be `"a,b,c"`. This is due to [this line](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/blob/b4231bbfdc967faf5c83eb44104c9f23bfce57e8/app/src/main/java/fr/free/nrw/commons/Utils.java#L204) where the argument should have been `piece` instead of `pieces`. 

The functionality of this method is identical to that of `TextUtils.join(‚Ä¶)` so this is (and always has been) a pointless method.

body:
The method denoted in this PR is cleaner than the way it is currently implemented, and also any concern of the race condition of `APPLICATION_VERSION` (noted [here](https://github.com/commons-app/apps-android-commons/blob/master/app/src/main/java/fr/free/nrw/commons/CommonsApplication.java#L55)) is removed.

The method used in this PR is described [here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/21119027/3424405) whereas the current implementation is described [here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/6593822/3424405).

Note that defining the `versionCode` and `versionName` in `build.gradle` is logically equivalent to defining it in `AndroidManifest.xml` (as described [here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/32138560/3424405)). It is necessary to define these attributes in `build.gradle` as the `BuildConfig` constants wouldn't be generated otherwise.

body:
Use `PreferenceFragment`, easier to maintain preferences, recommended way of doing it in API level > 11 (our minSdkVersion is 15). Also have updated SingleUploadFragment and Utils to work better, and use new arrays.xml.

I think the most controversial change is requiring Utils helper methods to be passed a context. This is to access the strings so we don't duplicate stuff e.g. creating `Licenses` in `Prefs.java` - there's already so many similar string names, we don't need more!

As this is quite a big change affecting a large number of files I think it's best if it is approved by at least 2 people before it's merged.

A quick explanation of what I've done:
- Removed `Licenses` constant in Prefs, prefer using `arrays.xml` (which in turn inherits from `strings.xml`)
- Move most of the code in SettingsActivity into SettingsFragment, and remove code no longer needed to force an ActionBar
- setOnPreferenceChangeListener's on the spinner to update the summary as before, and recreate the activity to update the theme straight away when changed
- Tidy up Utils, remove code blocks for API levels < 11 (current minSdkVersion is 15)
- Require context to be passed to Utils to compare strings
- Update SingleUploadFragment to not duplicate values again, use `arrays.xml` instead (which in turn inherits from `strings.xml`). May be an idea to move large if block getting license shorthand from name from SingleUploadFragment to Utils.
- Move "Become a beta tester" link in settings to bottom

Please do ask any questions about anything else, will either help spot potential bugs or you'll be able to maintain it easier later :)

body:
This was mostly inspired by the way the [Google IO App](https://github.com/google/iosched/blob/2016/android/src/debug/res/values/placeholder_strings.xml) handles placeholder strings.

Some benefits that I can think of of this are:

1. Makes strings separate from layout file
2. If you want to see other languages in the layout editor, then adding new languages will be the same as usual (except adding it to `debug/res` instead of `main/res`). This means that the source code of the layout doesn't have to constantly be changed to see the effect of a different language (e.g. English which is written from left to right would look different from Hebrew which is written right to left) but the language settings can be modified from the layout editor instead.

Note that I have strayed slightly from the Google IO App's implementation of this by omitting `translatable=false` from the string resources values in `placeholder_strings.xml` due to point no. 2 listed above.

body:
Closes #359.

Google's default Checkstyle uses two spaces instead of 4, so this was the only modification to the `checkstyle.xml`. Modification and the source of the `checkstyle.xml` is noted at the top of the file.

An HTML report is produced at `build/reports/checkstyle/checkstyle.html` when the `checkstyle` Gradle task is run. As `check` is set to depend on `checkstyle`, running `check` also runs this task. This means that Travis will now run Checkstyle as Travis runs the `check` Gradle task.

The Java code hasn't been reformatted to respect the Checkstyle rules, so a lot of errors should occur (`1108` at this time of build).

body:
The `styles.xml` in `values-v9` is redundant as the `@style/ProgressBar` is always being overridden by the `@style/ProgressBar` defined in `values-v14/styles.xml`. Hence I could safely delete `values-v9/styles.xml` without affecting the behaviour of the app.

Defining a `values-v14/styles.xml` is unnecessary as the `minSdk` is `15` so the styles in that file would always have been used over that of `values/styles.xml`. So I moved those styles to `values/styles.xml` and set the parent to the AppCompat's material theme. As it was already set for `@style/AppTheme`, is was only necessary to modify the `@style/ProgressBar` parent.

Fixes #48 . This works appropriately (redirects user to login screen) after creation of the first account. If the user tries to create a 2nd account, the redirection doesn't work (the user isn't redirected, although they can manually return by back button). Reinstalling the app resolves this.

Given that a user is expected to only create an account once, I think this is a minor bug so we can release this for the time being while I try to figure out the reason.

body:
The most significant and relevant changes are in ShareActivity.java

Also I've found (I'm not sure how) but the app is happy to upload the image without any permissions so it has to be reading it from somewhere. Because of this the current implementation is to provide an option to the user via a snackbar to additionally give storage+location permissions, which allows the app to extract extra metadata when uploading. What's strange is that it must be possible without these permissions as a test upload I did included all the EXIF data when I gave the app no permissions, so we could change to extract it out of that.

However we should consider if we want to force the user to give storage rights as otherwise often (it seems a bit random) the date is not added. Alternatively we could supply a date field?

Also I have tested this on my phone (running 6.0.1), and a range of emulators however I don't have a physical device with API<=20 to test it on atm, so it would be good if someone could check before this is merged :)

Also fixed a very small bug when testing, so incorrect password error is correctly recognised (WrongPluginPass).

EDIT - meant API <= 22
